Diabetic Chicken Salad Recipe

If you're looking for a delicious and healthy meal option, look no further than this diabetic-friendly chicken salad recipe. Packed with flavor and low in carbohydrates, this dish is perfect for those who need to watch their blood sugar levels.

To start, you'll need the following ingredients:

  • 2 cups cooked chicken breast, shredded
  • 1 cup celery, diced
  • 1/2 cup red onion, diced
  • 1/4 cup plain Greek yogurt
  • 1/4 cup light mayonnaise
  • 2 tablespoons Dijon mustard
  • 1 tablespoon lemon juice
  • 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • Lettuce leaves for serving

In a large bowl, combine the shredded chicken, celery, and red onion. In a separate smaller bowl, whisk together the Greek yogurt, light mayonnaise, Dijon mustard, lemon juice, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Pour the dressing over the chicken mixture and toss until well coated.

Once the salad is mixed, you can serve it immediately or refrigerate it for a few hours to let the flavors meld together. When you're ready to serve, place a scoop of the chicken salad onto a bed of lettuce leaves and enjoy!

This diabetic chicken salad recipe is not only low in carbohydrates, but it's also high in protein, which can help keep you feeling full and satisfied. The Greek yogurt and light mayonnaise provide a creamy texture without adding unnecessary fat or sugar.

Feel free to customize this recipe to your liking by adding in other vegetables such as bell peppers or carrots. You can also experiment with different herbs and spices to enhance the flavor even more.

Whether you're diabetic or simply looking for a healthy meal option, this chicken salad recipe is a winner. It's easy to make, packed with nutrients, and most importantly, it tastes delicious. Give it a try and see for yourself!
